items.description: A core bartending tool used to chill, dilute, and mix ingredients efficiently. Common types include the Boston shaker, Cobbler shaker, and French shaker.
A thick glass vessel used for stirring cocktails that should remain clear and smooth, such as spirit-forward drinks.
A long-handled spoon designed for stirring cocktails, layering ingredients, and precise small measurements.
A strainer with a coiled spring used to hold back ice when pouring shaken cocktails.
A perforated strainer traditionally used with mixing glasses for stirred cocktails.
A small mesh strainer used to remove fine ice shards or pulp for a smoother final drink.
A tool used to gently press herbs, fruits, or sugar to release flavors without over-extracting bitterness.
A handheld tool for extracting fresh juice from lemons, limes, or oranges efficiently.
Used to create citrus peels for garnishes and aromatic expression over drinks.
A double-sided measuring tool used to ensure accurate and consistent pours.
Occasionally used for batching cocktails or measuring larger liquid quantities.
Proper tools ensure consistency, accuracy, efficiency, and quality control behind the bar.
